This code chunk is part of a PandAI implementation demonstrating the 'seek' behavior. It includes the setup for an AI world, initialization of an AI character with specified parameters (mass, max force, max speed), addition of the character to the AI world, assignment of seek behavior towards a target, and the loop for continuously updating the AI world to execute the seek behavior. The code also sets up the necessary tasks to ensure continuous AI updates during runtime.

Context:
The chunk defines essential methods in a Panda3D application to implement 'seek' using PandAI, including AIWorld creation, AICharacter setup with movement parameters, assigning seek behavior towards a target NodePath, and setting up a task to continuously update the AI simulation.

def setAI(self):
        #Creating AI World
        self.AIworld = AIWorld(render)

        self.AIchar = AICharacter("seeker",self.seeker, 100, 0.05, 5)
        self.AIworld.addAiChar(self.AIchar)
        self.AIbehaviors = self.AIchar.getAiBehaviors()

        self.AIbehaviors.seek(self.target)
        self.seeker.loop("run")

        #AI World update
        taskMgr.add(self.AIUpdate, "AIUpdate")

    #to update the AIWorld
    def AIUpdate(self, task):
        self.AIworld.update()
        return Task.cont

w = World()
base.run()
